meanings.definition: The basic monetary unit of Mongolia.
meanings.sent1: In Mongolia, people use the tugrik to buy things.
meanings.sent2: I exchanged my dollars for tugriks at the bank.
meanings.sent3: The tugrik in my pocket felt like a tiny treasure.
meanings.sent4: His savings were like a pile of tugriks waiting to be spent.
meanings.sent5: The shiny tugrik coin glinted in the sunlight.

meanings.definition: A unit of currency equal to one hundredth of a Mongolian tugrik.
meanings.sent1: She saved up a few tugriks to buy a snack.
meanings.sent2: The price was just a few tugriks, so I paid with coins.
meanings.sent3: I found a lost tugrik on the street and felt lucky.
meanings.sent4: His wealth was like counting grains of sand, each worth a tugrik.
meanings.sent5: The tugrik was so small, it almost got lost in my hand.

meanings.sent1: Shops in Mongolia accept only tugriks for payment.
meanings.sent2: Tourists need to exchange their money for tugriks when visiting.
meanings.sent3: The tugrik symbol on the banknote looked like a little flag.
meanings.sent4: Her dreams were filled with colorful tugriks floating in the air.
meanings.sent5: The sound of tugriks clinking together was music to his ears.
